abstract: After nearly two years of saying that his views on same-sex marriage were "evolving," President Barack Obama said Wednesday that "for me personally it is important for me to go ahead and affirm that I think same-sex couples should be able to get married." Long a proponent of civil unions, Mr. Obama said his views had changed in part because of prodding by friends who are gay and by conversations with his wife and daughters

headline.main: Obama Says Same-Sex Marriage Should Be Legal
